metadata.title: CVE-2020-7942 puppet: Arbitrary catalog retrieval (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in Puppet, where changes in the application lead to node declarations having increased access. An attacker can use this flaw to modify run facts and to retrieve different nodes of information when the `strict_hostname_checking` is false, and the node's catalog falls back to the `default` node.
            
            MITIGATION: In the puppet.conf configuration file set `strict_hostname_checking = true`.

criterions.comment: puppetserver is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
puppet-agent is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
